attributes.action: Allow a step-father to be named on a marriage certificate.
attributes.background: Only the biological fathers name is currently permitted on a marriage certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
That's extremely unfair to the step-father's that do a better job and are more deserving of the title. With proof of a marriage certificate, we should be able to record the step-father's name on the form.
Step-fathers were previously permitted to be named, however that rule changed in February.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Increase the interest rate freelancers can claim for late payment.
attributes.background: Under the Late Payment of Commercial Debts Act 1998, Businesses can claim 8% interest plus the current Bank of England base rate. However this is not enough to deter larger companies from taking advantage of freelancers carrying out non-contracted work, i.e a one-off job.
attributes.additional_details: Late payment can severely impact a freelancer especially during a period of no work therefore it is important that they are able to claim fair compensation, not only to deter companies from exploiting them but to live. If a freelancer were to work one day for £100 and were not paid within 30 days of the client receiving the invoice, the freelancer could claim 8.25% interest (Bank of England base rate of 0.25%) meaning the annual interest would be £8.25 (approximately 0.0226 pence per day).

attributes.action: Organise parade in London for TeamGB and ParalympicsGB following 2016 Rio Games
attributes.background: TeamGB is doing a breathtaking job in Rio and ParalympicsGB will do just the same.  This is a wonderful, breathtaking achievement and something everyone in the UK can take pride in.  We should show our appreciation as a nation by holding a homecoming parade like we did in 2012.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Spend £6m of foreign aid so 40 or Paralympics teams can attend Rio2016
attributes.background: There are around 40 countries that are unable to attend the Paralympics in Rio because of a funding shortfall. As well as being a good thing to do, it would show GB in a good light.  https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/aug/14/paralympic-committee-to-hold-budget-crisis-talks-with-brazil

attributes.action: Make it an offence to protest at an equality event or celebration
attributes.background:
Events that celebrate or try to raise awareness of equality issues In the UK should be safe places. 
If you attend a pride or rally, you shouldn't have to face people who are protesting against your human rights & entitlements.
Protesting (even peacefully) at these events should be an offence!
attributes.additional_details:
Equality is for everybody. 
I agree that all are entitled to an opinion but an opinion that affects somebody's rights should be kept to yourself. 

People who are celebrating, I.e. Gay pride, deserve to feel safe & to be in a non-judgemental environment at these events. With protesters there, you often find arguments start, abuse & threats are often directed at those celebrating. 


Humans rights are for everyone, regardless of any factor.

attributes.action: Cancel BoE‘s cash injection to the financial sector, replace it with People's QE
attributes.background: The Bank of England’s planned cash injection to financial services will inflate asset prices, discourage saving and increase inequality. Government should instruct the Bank to implement a programme of People's Quantitative Easing instead to stimulate private spending and reduce UK household debt.
attributes.additional_details: Economists internationally have criticised the Bank’s decision, as it fails to address the greater risk to our economy: businesses and households cutting spending in the wake of increasing economic uncertainty. The BoE’s £375 billion programme of QE has damaged the UK economy since 2009 by inflating asset prices. These policies discourage saving and make it difficult for ordinary people to live, further increasing inequality and resulting suffering and anger that is corrosive to our society.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid contribution from 0.7% to 0.2% GDP
attributes.background: In the current climate of government cuts to our Local authorities, NHS and social funding (specifically OAP) it is completely unacceptable to be sending approximately 12 billion pounds of UK tax payers money out of the country when our own services are failing.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Make the Asylum seeker dispersal scheme mandatory to all councils in the U.K.
attributes.background:
The process in which Asylum seekers are granted housing in the U.K. is dependant on councils that volunteer to be part of the scheme. 
Currently, there is no mandatory requirement for all councils to participate meaning that councils are able to, and do abstain from the effort.
attributes.additional_details:
The humanitarian crisis we are facing should not be left only to those councils most willing, as it creates an unnecessarily large strain on some councils that should be shared. 

At least 38 councils have not signed up to the scheme which includes the rehoming of refugee children who entered the UK alone. 

The current voluntary system is unfair, and means that schools, healthcare resources and other public services in participating councils are needlessly overstretched.

attributes.action: Give clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens
attributes.background: I'd like Theresa May to finally give a clear statement about the post-brexit future of EU citizens who've been living and working in the UK for many years. Their future is now one big question mark and people need to know what's going to happen to them. For many UK became home and only place to live
attributes.additional_details: Since the start of brexit campaign the subject of EU citizens living and working in UK has beed avoided and so far there are only questions and no answers at all. People made UK their homes, have jobs, children (who often are british citizens), bought their first houses and settled in. Now this all is one big question mark and people fear that their lives can be turned upside down within two years time.

attributes.action: Bring back the YTS scheme for the many small businesses.
attributes.background: I am a blacksmith (I am 54), i would love to pass on my skills and keep teach a young person the ropes, however as a small business myself, we just break even as i have invested all our profit into new equipment, i looked into having an apprentice and its currently impossible

attributes.action: Another Scottish independence referendum should not be allowed to happen
attributes.background: We in Scotland are fed up of persecution by the SNP leader who is solely intent on getting independence at any cost. As a result, Scotland is suffering hugely.

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: If a person has a multiple birth they should be given more time off work.
attributes.background: Why should you get 1 year off for one baby and the same amount of time for more than one. If someone has multiples it's really hard to bond or even get in a routine.
attributes.additional_details: It's stressful trying to find childcare for more than one baby also while there only 9 month I really believe multiple mums should get more time off work

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Theresa May as PM over withheld information on Trident
attributes.background: The Commons voted to renew the £2.9b/year Trident nuclear missile program. We, the taxpayers, respect the outcome of democracy. However, if Theresa May made clear that Trident had malfunctioned, the result of the vote may have changed. Impeach the PM for dishonesty and a disservice to the people.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/0WlVMeIEYpk
The PM repeatedly avoided a clear question on this issue, providing no reassurance to the public or the Commons about the safety of Trident.
The Trident Comission estimates that £2.9 billion will be spent annually on Trident. If it is not in working order, it poses a massive risk to the world, as well as being a waste of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Make All Public Parking including Hospitals 'FREE' for the Disabled
attributes.background:
It is a disgrace to make these pay, it it hit and miss with some charging and others not, should be the same throughout the country, I know some abuse the system with Blue Badges and should lose them for ever, the charges incurred it a lot of money for Disabled people.
We need a Three Hour system.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospitals make a lot of money already on poorly people, the Disabled should not be one, this is being Anti Disabled and must not be discriminated against.

Let's get things put in order with a system that the Disabled do not have to study each place on if they can or can not.

Disabled Agency sorts some things but money matters to these people on Low income.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Fully fund A&E and urgent care by a specific A&E tax paid by most people.
attributes.background: There is national alarm at the state of many A and E departments with excessive waiting times and some inappropriate use by people who should be treated elsewhere. Separate funding paid for fully by a broad based tax to which most if not all contribute is needed to provide sufficient urgent care.
attributes.additional_details:
Refer to sensible views of Philippa Whitford in the NHS and Social Care funding in the House of Commons on Jan 11th 2017. She presents the impressive model as practised in Scotland.
Everyone knows that A and E is not coping in many parts of the country. This is exacerbated by the lack of GP availability out of hours and at weekends. Demand has risen due to an ageing population and lack of alternative facilities. A and E is one of the few services that virtually everybody will use in their lives.

attributes.action: Rape offences tried on the balance of probability NOT beyond reasonable doubt
attributes.background: In the UK the conviction rate for rape cases is 4% this is not encouraging for rape victims to come forward. It is extremely difficult to convince a jury to convict a perpetrator beyond all reasonable doubt this is why the numbers are so low I propose I change in the law to help victims of rape
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from The British Crime Survey reveal that 89% of rapes go unreported, and 38% of victims don’t tell anyone. It is unrealistic to assess a rape case beyond all reasonable doubt if the victim is known to the defendant or is the defendants partner etc this is virtually impossible as there will always be the argument of consensual sex therefore giving the element of doubt. 97% of calls to the Rape Crisis helpline are from victims who knew their attackers, if we try defendants based on the balance of probability we will have a better chance of convictions and will incourage more victims to come forward.

attributes.action: Nominate Tunstall Tower Square as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
attributes.background: Tunstall Tower Square in Stoke on Trent is an indicative example of Tower squares across the country. In an area of high cultural significance for the country and for the industrial revolution which changed the world forever the Tower Square should be protected.

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal for members of Bomber Command in WW2.
attributes.background: 55,573 members of Bomber Command were killed in WW2 and have never received any official recognition for their sacrifice. It is time this injustice was corrected.

attributes.action: Make all motorway matrix signs read Keep Left Unless Overtaking when not in use
attributes.background: Middle-lane-sitting is a common problem for many motorway users, and often results on excessive overtaking speed, undertaking, road rage and congestion. I think this problem is largely caused by ignorance of proper road use and could be eased by instructing drivers to keep left using overhead signs.
attributes.additional_details: As stated in the Highway Code (goo.gl/zagJKH) road users should keep left on the motorway and move back to the left as soon as they have overtaken, however for many drivers it has been years since they learned this rule. The result of this is poor road use resulting in heavy congestion and frustration for others. The overhead announcement boards could easily be used, when not displaying live notices, to say "Keep Left Unless Overtaking" to remind road users of how to use the motorways properly.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: NHS Charges for non National insurance payers
attributes.background: This issue is important because the NHS needs help and people that do not pay into the national insurance program should be asked to pay for their treatment received, We as tax payers all have NI Numbers
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is that when we are first seen in A&E we are asked for our NI card as proof that we are entitled to free treatment, If we cannot provide this then we are asked how we are going to pay either Credit card or insurance documents. Just like checking into a hotel the card is swiped at first contact. On completion of treatment the card on insurance company are charged at the going rate of charges, This will help prevent the strain on NHS resources, and bring us in line with other countries

attributes.action: Make it law for drivers to slow down and move over when they see roadworkers
attributes.background: every year a number of recovery operators and roadside technicians and other roadworkers are killed because of people not giving enough room when we are working on motorways. when they see flashing orange beacons slow down and move over to the middle lane to give us enough room to work safely

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid payments at the beginning of the next fiscal year.
attributes.background: We need to reallocate all funds to projects within the UK, such as homeless shelters built in every city in the UK with a full time GP, medical and social care staff including drug and alcohol abuse, PTSD, catering and educational facilities and education and retraining facilities.
attributes.additional_details: That for a period of one year no foreign aid be paid and that at the end of that year, the government then uses a jury picked in the same way as the current judicial system to hear each case of requested aid from foreign countries. Furthermore that a list of qualifying criteria is put in place prior to any allocation of funds. Such as no country with a GDP higher than ours can request money, that the goverent of the country is an elected one, that the country does not have a nuclear program.

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: Ensure all Cafcass calls and meetings are recorded and both parties get a copy
attributes.background: Due to personal experience of having a Cafcass telephone interview not reflect my issues, I began to look at net mums and other site representative of both sexes and I've found many people found this happening. All calls and meetings should be recorded for safety to ensure key information is saved.
attributes.additional_details: Since most organisations like insurances record calls it seems a serious failing data gathered in the best interest of a child is not recorded. If a report does not reflect what a parent or other person says the recording could be sent to court to validate the person. A report missing key information causes distress and goes against the person as the court presume Cafcass to be efficient. Recording provides proof for all parties.

attributes.action: A law that Family Courts factor evidence of Alienation Inducement in its ruling
attributes.background: Children being alienated from one parent by another is common in Family Court contact requests or custody cases. This is psychologically harmful to the child and prolongs the court process unnecessarily. There are many papers about Alienation Inducement and the consequent Parent Alienation Syndrome

attributes.action: Entirely ban the use of BPA for the packaging of any product sold in UK
attributes.background:
BPA stands for bisphenol A. It is found in plastics that are used in containers that store food and beverages like water bottles. 
Exposure to BPA is a concern because of health effects on the brain, behavior and prostate gland of fetuses, infants & children. Also links to infertility & cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Additional research suggests a possible link between BPA and increased blood pressure , cancer, infertility and birth defects.

http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/221205.php

The human experiment - documentary that can be found on Netflix / you tube

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Reduce the Foreign Aid budget and use the monies to fund Social Housing
attributes.background: Reduce the Foreign Aid Budget and use the monies to fund a Social Housing scheme to ensure all UK Veterans and homeless families have somewhere safe to live.  Any monies left can also fund Social Housing for the rest of the Country and then use the rents raised towards upkeep.
